sentence.text: Fungal immunomodulatory protein from Nectria haematococca (positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter by glucose-nha) has potential as a lung cancer therapeutic; as such, illuminating its anti-tumor mechanism is expected to facilitate novel treatment options.

entity.text: positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter by glucose

sentence.text: Thus, we comprehensively revealed the anti-tumor mechanism of positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter by glucose-nha, which inhibits tumor growth by modulating PI3K/positive regulation of protein phosphorylation-regulated cell cycle arrest, autophagy, and apoptosis, and provided the basis for further application of fungal immunomodulatory proteins, especially FIP-nha

entity.text: positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter by glucose
